message.content: This question requires an understanding of the cycle of seasons and the timing of specific events in nature. Spring is a season where many plants, including irises, begin budding and blooming. If a person loves spring and it has just passed, they will have to wait until the next spring season to enjoy it again. Option (A) is unrelated to the timing of seasons. Option (C) is a arbitrary measure of time and not related to the timing of spring. Option (D) refers to the transition from summer to fall and is not related to the timing of spring.

Therefore, if someone loves spring and it has just passed by, they will most likely enjoy it again the next time most irises begin budding. Option (A) is unrelated to the concept of seasons and blooming patterns. Option (C) is too short of a time frame for a whole season to pass. Option (D) is related to the changing of seasons, but not specifically to the blooming of flowers.
